title: (x) late 70s-early 80s font on Boards Of Canada album cover - Harry Obese {Ignacio}
content:
an album cover by boards of canada, the text in question is the band name, boards of canada. i don't know the font off hand but it looks like something that was popular in around the beginning of the 80s, though it could be made to look like that. thanks for your help!

[http://ec1.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/ciu/c7/66/ae5512bb9da0e83dac64c010.L.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120219231003/http:/ec1.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/ciu/c7/66/ae5512bb9da0e83dac64c010.L.jpg)
author: alexgrimley

comments.content:
I think it is a Harry Obese modified, some of the characters (R, F, N, A) are exactly the same. I just have found digitized the [Squeeze](http://web.archive.org/web/20120219231003/http:/www.identifont.com/list?2+harry+2+23N+183+2WG+0+7NW+0) version but still you can see it.  
There is a sample in the Phil's Homage To The Alphabet catalog (p.205).

Ignacio is correct. You can get someone close with [Neo Sans Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20120219231003/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/neo_sans_ultra/?sample_text=BOARDS%20OF%20CANADA&sample_size=36).
